responses.rationale: The segment reports historical culling numbers, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports current cases and culling numbers, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes a planned action by authorities ('authorities will cull') which is a response measure/safeguard.
The segment reports case location and count, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports cases in other countries, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment describes a measure ('sanitary radius') and a future action ('authorities would decide on possible culling').
The segment describes a consequence (eggs disappear) and reason (hens cooped up), not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes a measure ('chickens have been in bird flu lockdown') which is a safeguard.
The segment describes a past measure (grace period) and current requirement, not capabilities or preparedness.
The segment describes a future possibility ('When the measures... are lifted, eggs will go back').
The segment describes a measure ('hens temporarily housed to protect their health') which is a safeguard.
The segment describes future possibilities ('risk levels have reduced', 'measures have been lifted', 'birds will be able to go outside').
The segment describes a development capability ('France has been trialling bird flu vaccines').

The segment reports developments and concerns, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
The segment reports outbreaks, not capabilities or preparedness measures.
